Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Minister S.B. Dissanayake deploys thugs to kill a UNP supporter, when in fact the image shows a man participating in an emergency response drill.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Minister S.B. Dissanayake was involved in deploying thugs to kill a UNP supporter.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the image of a bloodied man is evidence of Minister S.B. Dissanayake's involvement in the killing, without considering alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the image actually shows a man participating in an emergency response drill, as confirmed by the local news page and the administrator.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image is from an emergency response drill, not a real incident involving the killing of a UNP supporter.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
